content:
If at the time any claim arises under this Policy there is any other insurance policy effected by or on behalf of You with other insurance company covering the same expenses, We shall only be liable for the remaining amount which You are not compensated for.

#### Section 3. Children Education Grant
We will pay You the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule to Your surviving Child(ren) if You suffer Accidental Death as a result of an Injury.

#### Section 4. Parents Support Grant
We will pay You the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule to Your surviving parent(s) if You suffer Accidental Death as a result of an Injury.

#### Section 5. No Claims Bonus
If no claim has been made under this Policy after twelve (12) consecutive months, We will refund 15% of the premium that You have paid at the end of each annual period.
Provided that:
(a) There has been no interruption of cover for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months.
(b) Premium has been fully paid.
questions: How does the policy handle claims when there is overlapping coverage from another insurance policy for the same expenses, and what portion of the claim will this policy cover?
Under what conditions will the Children Education Grant be paid, who is eligible to receive it, and what documentation or proof is required to establish entitlement following an Accidental Death?
What are the specific criteria for the Parents Support Grant to be payable, who qualifies as surviving parents, and how is the Benefit Limit determined according to the Policy Schedule?

How does the No Claims Bonus operate in terms of timing, premium payment status, and continuity of coverage, and what percentage of the premium is refunded after twelve consecutive months without a claim?

If a policyholder has multiple insurance policies covering the same injury-related expenses, how does the coordination of benefits affect the total compensation received, and does this policy act as primary or secondary payer?
What happens to the No Claims Bonus if there is an interruption in coverage within the twelve-month period, and how does this affect the refund eligibility?

In the event of an Accidental Death, how are the Children Education Grant and Parents Support Grant benefits coordinated if both surviving children and parents exist, and can both grants be claimed simultaneously?
What are the implications for the No Claims Bonus if the premium has not been fully paid, and does partial payment affect the refund amount or eligibility?
How does the policy define 'Injury' in relation to triggering the Children Education Grant and Parents Support Grant, and are there any exclusions or limitations related to the cause of injury?
If a claim is made under the Children Education Grant or Parents Support Grant, how does the presence of other insurance policies covering the same event impact the payout from this policy?
What documentation or proof is required to verify the surviving status of children or parents to qualify for the respective grants after an Accidental Death?

How is the Benefit Limit for the Children Education Grant and Parents Support Grant specified and adjusted in the Policy Schedule, and can these limits vary based on the insured's age or other factors?
Does the policy provide any exceptions or special considerations for the No Claims Bonus refund if claims are made under sections other than those involving Accidental Death?

How does the policy address the scenario where the insured has multiple children or multiple surviving parents in terms of distributing the Children Education Grant and Parents Support Grant benefits?
Are there any general exclusions or conditions in the policy that would prevent payment of the Children Education Grant or Parents Support Grant even if Accidental Death due to Injury occurs?
How does the policy ensure that the No Claims Bonus is only refunded after a full annual period, and what happens if the policy is cancelled or not renewed before the twelve months are completed?
In cases where the insured has other insurance policies with overlapping coverage, how is the 'remaining amount' calculated, and does this policy require notification of other policies at claim time?
What is the process and timing for receiving the No Claims Bonus refund, and is it automatically applied or must the insured request it at the end of the annual period?
How does the policy treat claims for the Children Education Grant and Parents Support Grant if the Accidental Death occurs outside the policy coverage area or during an excluded activity?
If a claim arises under this policy and the insured has not paid the premium in full, how does this affect the liability of the insurer for that claim and the eligibility for the No Claims Bonus?
